reviews.sentence: Stayed for Business. This was a very nice hotel. The rooms are clean and large and full of amenities. We ordered Room Service but found the food to be average. There was an error in our order which they did correct by coming back a second time but did charge me another room service fee for. That was a little disappointing. The pool could use a little updating.

Beautiful Hotel. Till You Stay There. Started with a long drive and a seemingly hurried check in. Got to my room with all my luggage and the key did not work so I had to go back down and have the key reset. Was impressed by the facilities lobby pool and work out room. Walked into my room and saw a huge sliding door and got excited until there was no way to open it it had rusted shut. And yes I had removed the security bar. Then I had left my bathmat down on the floor from my shower after my work out the night before and when i went to readjust it there were two large bugs under the mat. Left my toiletries case in the bathroom because I did not want to put it back in my suitcase. Then i went down to breakfast and was asked if I wanted the buffet or to order off a menu and I said the buffet was fine. Had an egg and a piece of toast with coffee and was presented with a bill for 1695. There was no signs indicating that they would charge that for a simple breakfast. I made it a point to check out and tell the clerk about my issues and was promised that they would add an extra 70 points to my Hilton Honors account and it is now a month later that did not happen either. I will not stay there again.
The room was clean and my stay was quite although there was a girls softball team down the hall. Had a very long walk to get to and from the elevator.

Hotel experience. Excellent service clean quiet very helpful at registration Easy parking nice pool friendly staff courteous employees. Clean fresh linen water bottles and coffee and chocolate in the room nice dining room facility and menu.

Syracuse holiday stay. Clean and friendly hotel that is maintaining it is facilities with new carpets paint and other up grades. The pool and other workout facilities are great. Hotel staff went out of their way to make our visit a great one. The restaurant was very good good food and fast service.

Overnight near Airport. Needed a good place with quick shuttle to airport. Has a good restaurant decent gym and nice pool. Met all my traveling needs. They had several events and appear to be able to handle large numbers well.

everything you expect from a fine hotel. I chose to stay in E Syracuse because there are several decent hotels right off the Thruway and I was just passing though on my way to somewhere else. The Hilton Doubletree is one of the best of these hotels and my preferred place to stay. The staff is courteous and efficient the rooms are clean and comfortable the amenities are well kept up and the restaurant is quite good. There are less expensive hotels in the area but the quality is worth the price.

Good enough. The hotel is a minimalistic place with all necessary facilities. The receptionist may at night be not very polite. The room is good and complete with all facilities. It was interesting in which they permitted four of us to share a room. This kept our expenses to minimum.

What was expected. You expect Doubletree to be better then average. A lot of different visitors here. sport teams to weddings also tourists. Easy check in pleasant and attentive to you. Same with check out. Clean lobby hope you do not object to people and bags hanging there. Long walk to elevators passing the different conference and ballrooms and the pool door. For me wish the elevators were first and you did not have to walk past these rooms and disturb and commingle with dressed up people attending the functions but that can not be changed. Good resturant with diverse menu wether dinner or breakfast and a breakfast buffet with omelette chief. A full bar with chairs and sports TV. Tower is 7 floors so teams are separated from visitors. Rooms clean. No bugs. The rooms are spartan more wall treatment needed. Nice side chair but a bit tacky especially for a Doubletree are the white mini fridge and the exposed coffee machine table. Halls are barren meaning no wall treatments and also illuminated by harsh whitish lights like it was institutionalized.

Great palce in Central NY. This hotel was renovated a few years ago by Double Tree of the Hilton family. Excellent job with the facility. Rooms are well appointed and priced appropriately. Amenities are what you would expect of the Hilton brand. Always pleased when I stay here. Will stay here again. Recommend it if you are in the area for business or pleasure.

In renovation right now to be avoided. The room was fine but this facility in January 2017 is being renovated and nothing much is available beyond a small gym room. There were guests there but it felt a bit deserted and I would avoid it right now. Maybe some day it will be equipped with more than the offer of a chocolate chip cookie.

Overnight stay. Not good. No breakfast no water etc Place was being remodeled without any additional amenities to guests. In fact they took away previous amenities. I ve stayed there over 20 times always received a complimentary breakfast nothing this time.

Nice Rooms. Rooms were nice and clean. But no vending machines or outside deliveries allowed on the floor. We were unaware they were under renovations because their website makes it seem like they are finished. When we arrived the first we seen before the reception area was sheet rock and construction. The hallways were filled with supplies and luggage carts. The hotel itself is a maze to navigate made worse by the old signs and new design layout. Design flaws like Elevator to rooms on the opposite end of the hotel where you check in to.

Poor amenities construction nightmare. Very hard to navigate the hotel during construction vendor vehicles blocking the entrance in the morning no hot water 2 mornings out of 5 breakfast overpriced and terrible. I would not recommend staying here until they are done with construction at least.

Check in was very slow as front desk was on the phone on a personal call totally ignoring me After the first room not being acceptable they got it right finally on the second room. Garbage cigarette butts at the entrance for 3 days until finally cleaned up.

Return visit to Doubletree Syracuse. Recently had a return to this location. Knew that the refurbishments had been completed so was interested to see the changes from a year ago. Lobby area was the most noticeable transformation. Very bright and designed as a mixed use space with the restaurant flowing into lounge area immediately upon entrance via the sliding glass doors. A new bar is adjacent and was well attended. I thought the location of the bar was odd as it was very close at right angle to the Reception desk. Must be my age but was not a huge fan of this new layout. Just TOO open. sitting having a drink in the main travel path of the hotel is not appealing to me. Saw no noticeable changes to guest room entirely serviceable if uninspiringGreat to have the large 42 inch LG television thoughA bonus of this location is it is indoor and outdoor pool area. Very well maintained and pleasant. A new covered bar area adjacent to the outdoor pool promises to be a popular spot in the warm weather. There was a sparse offering of new polside furniture that while attractive was the MOST uncomfortable I have ever encounteredThe spread between seat back and leg knee bend is so far that it would only work for somebody VERY tall. somebody did not actually try these before purchase. lolTwo issues this tripUsed the on line check in via the Honors ap which I love. The process was not as fast as usual upon arrival and got a call afterwards saying my credit card had been declined. After a call to provider who assured me all was fine. they suggested that the expiration had been entered incorrectly. After having to return to reception this in fact WAS the case. Why. All my information should be on file with HonorsHandled politely. but who needs that hassle after a day of travelThere is a serious issue with sewer gas in the elevator shaft that makes use of the elevator practically unbearable. Not sure what THAT is all about but should be rectified quickly. Gives an otherwise freshly done facility a literal bad smelGod job overall though competing with the plethora of other choices in the area.

Not a great place to must. Stayed here while visiting SU. Lobby is very nice but does not match with the rest of the hotel. The halls are a little musty. In he fourth floor it smells especially damp. The room we were given first on the fourth floor had a moldy smell and you could see the water damage in the ceiling that was painted over. The white ceiling paint was starting to turn color again. Asked for a different room and were given a better location on 3rd floor. Room smelled better. Had asked for a rolaway when I made the reservation. Did not get one until nearly 11 PM. Nearly 3 hours later. The front desk told me that I had a do not disturb sign up which was BS. We got the bed finally but no sheets. They had a security guy doing double duty as a room steward and it took him several trips to get everything we needed. Sheets. Blankets. I do not think he knew where to get them because the ones we got were very old. In the end we had a pillow without a pillowcase. The people working there were very nice but I would not come back here.

Spoke with someone on the phone in regards to renting out their ballroom. She was extremely rude and basically made my event seem like it was unimportant. And that she would not even consider booking something like that a year in advance. I would NOT recommend booking any events with them.

The lobby was impressive in a conventional sense but that was what made the rest of the hotel so disappointing. You immediately realize once you walked to where the rooms are that that is the part of the hotel that did not receive the budget to be upgraded. Everything seemed old beds comfort was okay but they could use some new pillows. We requested a crib to be in the room when we arrived for our 1yo a week ahead by calling and even the front desk noticed that memo on our reservation but nothing was done about it. We also found that the phone did not work when we arrived at the room so we had to walk to the front desk to ask for the crib. Phone was never looked at or changed but it took 4 attempts yes walking from our room on the 3rd floor to the front desk through a long hallway where the catering events space were for them to eventually made that happen. We thought since this hotel carries the name Hilton it would be good but nothing can be further from that. Good luck if you have a child and stay in this hotel.
The bathroom smelled of mildew and there were black hairs in the bathtub. The hallways were full of people ’s food left over night. NEVER AGAIN.

Rooms were clean comfortable and the Wifi was good. Our room was located right beside the elevators and we did nt have any issues with that however the walls between the rooms are quite thin. We heard our neighbours talk and you know what all night long. nothing the hotel staff could control but still something to take under consideration if you need a quite room.

Not poor but less than average. Unimpressed with the DoubleTree in Syracuse. The hotel is years past a much needed room update despite what the cool modern lobby would indicate. Rooms do not have USB chargers and are lacking in amenities you would find at a cheaper hotel. Bathrooms are very small and again in need of update. Breakfast is a complete ripof and not that good. Do not recommend eating at this hotel. Customer service is hit or miss checked in after midnight and they could not be less enthused to work there and help us. No special treatment for Hilton Honors. On the plus side the gym is very nice likely updated the same time as the lobby. There in the dead of winter but I bet the outdoor pool is nice in the summer. I spent some time looking from the machines in the gym into the indoor version of the pool. If looking for modern convenience in Syracuse look elsewhere. This hotel needs a remodel very badly everywhere but the lobby and gym.
